intro: Warczewiczella violacea, commonly known as the violet warczewiczella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in small inflorescences. Warczewiczella violacea is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in warm, humid environments.
